metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0470 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
super.c in Super 3.30.0 does not check the return value of the setuidfunction when the -F flag is set, which allows local users to gainprivileges via unspecified vectors, aka an RLIMIT_NPROC attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0470` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

super - 3.30.0-6+deb7u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: super package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.30.0-6+deb7u1build0.14.04.1').
